questions.text: Whose absence would secretly make this group calmer?
Who here would trade loyalty for glory if the price was right?
Who is most likely to betray a promise—and justify it beautifully?
Whom would you trust with a secret that could end a friendship?
Who turns small problems into beautiful disasters?
In a crisis, whose calm would feel like poetry—and whose like panic?
Who is most likely to burn a bridge, then light a cigarette with it?
Whose advice sounds wise—but costs you the most to follow?
Who flirts with chaos like it’s an art form?
At 3 AM, who answers—and who only replies when it’s easy?
Who will be rich first—and loneliest sooner?
Whose style seduces—and whose substance disappoints?
Who lies the least—but hides the most?
Shipwrecked: who do you keep—and who do you keep an eye on?
Whose mistakes are loudest—and whose are prettiest?
Who outgrew this group—and who refuses to grow at all?
Who can start a war with a whisper?
Who would make a tender parent—and a terrifying judge?
Who confuses ambition with affection?
Whose search history would turn the room silent?
If you had to swap lives, whose shadows would you fear most?
Who keeps secrets to protect others—and who to protect themselves?
Who wins the fight—and loses the room?
Whose laugh makes you softer—and whose makes you suspicious?
Who feels deeply—and performs it beautifully?
Whom would you trust to design your future—without asking you?
Who delays dreams—and blames timing?
Whose quirks are charming—until you live with them?
Cross-country: who plans the route—and who becomes the story?
Who could gather followers with a smile—and never call it a cult?
Whose hug heals—and whose asks for more than they give?
Who wants the spotlight—and forgets who turned it on?
If you were guilty, who here could save you—and would they?
Who lives beautifully online—and badly in their room?
Who competes to connect—and who competes to win you?
Phone unlocked: who do you hand it to without a second thought?
Who sleeps through storms—and starts them awake?
Whose dancing is pure joy—and whose is pure performance?
Who would be a beautiful disaster as a roommate?
Who reminds you who you are—and who reminds you who to avoid?
